3.99. 
Spousal gifts 
1. The spouses shall have the right to make gifts of property to each other in accordance with the provisions of the sixth book of this Code governing the contract of gift. 
2. The contract of gift of immovable property shall have legal effects for the creditors of the donor only after the registration of this contract in the public register. 
3. The spouse of the donee shall be liable to the creditors of the donor for the obligations of the donor existing at the time of the conclusion of the contract of gift, but only in respect of the value of the gift. If the gifted property perishes through no fault of the spouse of the donee, his/her obligation to fulfil the obligations of the donor is extinguished.
